title: 'torch.cuda.LongTensor' object has no attribute 'neg'
body_html:
This code used to work on the previous version of pytorch, but does not work on the 0.2:

import torch
x = torch.LongTensor(10).random_(10)
x = torch.autograd.Variable(x)
y = 1 - x

It raises the following error:
AttributeError: 'torch.cuda.LongTensor' object has no attribute 'neg'

It works if x is a tensor and not a variable.
body_text:
This code used to work on the previous version of pytorch, but does not work on the 0.2:
import torch
x = torch.LongTensor(10).random_(10)
x = torch.autograd.Variable(x)
y = 1 - x
It raises the following error:
AttributeError: 'torch.cuda.LongTensor' object has no attribute 'neg'
It works if x is a tensor and not a variable.
body:
This code used to work on the previous version of pytorch, but does not work on the 0.2:

```python
import torch
x = torch.LongTensor(10).random_(10)
x = torch.autograd.Variable(x)
y = 1 - x
```

It raises the following error:
`AttributeError: 'torch.cuda.LongTensor' object has no attribute 'neg'`

It works if `x` is a tensor and not a variable.
